title: Tom Ellis confirms Lucifer won't be in Crisis On Infinite Earths
text:
Lucifer won’t be causing havoc in Crisis Of Infinite Earths after all (Picture: Netflix/The CW)

Sorry, guys – Lucifer will not be joining the DC Universe for Crisis Of Infinite Earths any time soon.

Tom Ellis, who plays the handsome devil on the Netflix series, has rubbished claims that the Lord of the Underworld will be dropping by for a cameo on the mega crossover.

Rumours started circulating that he would be on the show after he was spotted on set of the DC TV special – which will combine other DC heroes including those from Arrow, The Flash, Supergirl and a host of Superman stars old and new.

Shutting down the thoughts once and for all, he revealed: ‘I go to Vancouver for the weekend to visit my friend for his birthday and now suddenly I’m in a different show!’

Making sure he’s clear, he added to Entertainment Tonight: ‘No. Hard pass. Sorry. Sorry fans.’

Guess we’ll be waiting for the new time we see the star in Lucifer season five, which is currently being filmed in Los Angeles.

While Lucifer’s lack of appearance on Crisis Of Infinite Earths may be a bummer, there’s definitely no shortage of reasons to get hyped for the upcoming mini-series.

Becoming one of the biggest crossover events ever, the show will see the return of a lot of old faces over the decades of DC stars appearing on screen.

Crisis On Infinite Earths will be based on the comic books of the same name from the 1980s, where the 12-issue limited series essentially reset the entire DC Universe that had been created up until that point.

With the idea of multiverses and alternate timelines, former incarnations of Superman – including Brandon Routh and Smallville’s Tom Welling – will be back in the cape after decades away.

More: DC Comics Katherine McNamara reveals how Mia Smoak will cope meeting Oliver Queen in Arrow season 8 Joker-related porn searches are growing because people want to see a clown getting down Vincent D'Onofrio teases involvement in DC's The Batman after Zoe Kravitz casting

It will be led by the most recent stars of the connected world, including Ruby Rose’s Batwoman, The Flash, Supergirl, Legends of Tomorrow and Arrow.

It will air as a five-hour event – with the first three hours airing in December and the second half premiering in 2020.

Crisis Of Infinite Earths will air in December on The CW in the US, with an unconfirmed UK release date.
